intro: Acourtia scaposa, commonly known as the scapose acourtia, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland habitats. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish to white flowers. Acourtia scaposa is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained environments and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range.
